subject: Problem: testMethods executing out of order...
msgSnippet: I have been using JUnit with my EJB for awhile and it always ran the test methods in the order that they are in the code.. However, they just started to
messageBody:
I have been using JUnit with my EJB for awhile and it always ran the
test methods in the order that they are in the code.. However, they
just started to occationally run in a different order.. Which is
causing problems.

Has anyone come across this?

General idea of test code..
import junit.framework.*;
public class OrgTestCase extends TestCase
{
public TestSuite suite()
{
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(OrgTestCase.class);
return suite;
}

public void setUp()throws Exception
{
InitialContext context = new InitialContext();
transaction = (UserTransaction)context.lookup
("javax/transaction/UserTransaction");
orgHome = (OrgHome)context.lookup("ejb/OrgEntity");
}

public void tearDown()
throws Exception
{
orgVal = null;
orgHome = null;
org = null;
}
public void testCreate()throws Exception
{
}
public void testFindByPK()throws Exception
{
}
public void testFindByKeyword() throws Exception
{
}
public void testFindLikePks()throws Exception
{
}
public void testFindAll()throws Exception
{
}
public void testfindByDescription()throws Exception
{
}
public void testUpdateOrg()throws Exception
{
}
public void testRemoveOrg()throws Exception
{
}
}

It runs the
1) testCreate
2) testFindByPK
3) testRemoveOrg (which causes problems for the testUpdateOrg)
